business.headline: Rupee in freefall, slides past 90 against US dollar: What next?The key question now is whether the rupee stabilises or slides deeper. All eyes are on the RBI's policy signal, foreign flows, and any movement in the India–US trade talks.

Meesho IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check strength and key risksMeesho IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 5,421.20 crore. This includes a fresh issue of 38.29 crore shares worth Rs 4,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 10.55 crore shares worth Rs 1,171.20 crore.

Rupee hits all-time low, slips past 90 against US dollar for first timeThe rupee's slide to 90 heightens cost pressures for households and businesses, fuels import-driven inflation risks and leaves markets looking to the RBI for stronger support.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as rupee hits all-time lowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 8.15 points to 85,130.12, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.65 points to 26,016.55 as of 9:22 am.

Delhi startup founder shuts down company after 'frivolous complaint' by clientAccording to its LinkedIn profile, Wherehouse was founded in 2021 as a supply chain intelligence company, helping brands move closer to their customers, enabling faster and more efficient deliveries, and driving business growth.

RBI MPC meet begins today: Will rate cuts finally return?In its October meeting, the MPC kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% for a fourth straight time. RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra had then said that inflation had moderated sharply, giving the committee confidence to maintain its stance.

EU to push ahead with plan to use Russia's frozen assets for Ukraine: ReportEU leaders agreed in October to meet Ukraine's "pressing financial needs" for the next two years but stopped short of endorsing a plan to use 140 billion euros ($162 billion) in frozen Russian sovereign assets in Europe as a loan for Kyiv, due to concerns raised by Belgium.

From ICICI and HDFC to SBI: Here's what 5 major banks are charging on personal loansBefore applying for a personal loan, it's worth knowing how much the leading banks are charging at the moment. Whether you prefer a private lender or a public-sector bank, understanding the latest interest rates can guide you towards a smarter borrowing decision.

Rent, cars, credit: CA explains why old financial wisdom no longer worksThe financial world young earners face today looks nothing like what their parents experienced. From renting to car ownership, an expert says that traditional advice no longer fits today's numbers, and sticking to it may do more harm than good.
Sensex closes 500 points lower, Nifty below 26,100; RIL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 503.63 points to close at 85,138.27, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 143.55 points to end at 26,032.20.

Aequs IPO to open for bidding soon: Subscribe or skip the Rs 900 crore issue?Aequs IPO is sized at Rs 921.81 crore. This includes a fresh issue of 5.40 crore shares worth Rs 670 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.03 crore shares worth Rs 251.81 crore.

Planning to rent in 2025? Here's what changes with the new renting rulesOne of the biggest changes in the New Rent Rules 2025 is that all rental agreements must now be digitally stamped and registered online within 60 days

Rs 10,000 SIP vs Rs 1.2 lakh lump sum: Which creates more wealth?Is a Rs 10,000 monthly SIP smarter for long-term wealth, or does investing Rs 1.2 lakh at once create a bigger corpus? As markets turn unpredictable, this question is becoming more important for everyday investors.

Gold softens, silver drops: Why are they losing momentum after Monday's rally?Gold and silver paused their strong rally from Monday, opening lower on Tuesday amid profit booking and weaker global sentiment. The dip raises a key question: why have the metals lost momentum so quickly?

Will Nifty cross 29,000 by 2026? Here's what this global brokerage expectsDomestic flows remain steady, earnings have held up better than expected, and the broader macro backdrop has turned more predictable. Together, these have opened the door for fresh medium-term forecasts.

8th Pay Commission: Government clarifies on DA-basic pay merger plans. Details hereResponding to a written question in the Lok Sabha, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary stated that there is no proposal at present to combine any part of the existing DA with basic pay.

Meesho IPO to open soon: Will it turn into next stock market jackpot? Check GMPMeesho IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 5,421.20 crore. This includes a fresh issue of 38.29 crore shares worth Rs 4,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 10.55 crore shares worth Rs 1,171.20 crore.

The dark side of lending: Loan recovery harassment and its mental health impactLoan recovery harassment is real, widespread, and it is silently pushing many into anxiety, depression, and even suicide.

Explained: Why Bajaj Housing Finance shares fell 9% todayBajaj Housing Finance stock has now slipped almost 10% in the past 5 days, 13% in the past month, 22.83% in the last 6 months, 28.85% over the past year and 41.46% over the last five years.

entertainment.headline: The Vampire Diaries' Kat Graham announces pregnancy with husband Bryant Wood Kat Graham, known for Vampire Diaries, has announced her first pregnancy with husband Bryant Wood through elegant Instagram photos. The couple recently celebrated their second wedding ceremony.

BB 19: Shehbaz on Amaal's bromance, why he won't meet Ashnoor or Abhishek again In an exclusive interview with India Today, Shehbaz Badesha spoke about his eviction from Bigg Boss 19 before the finale. He expressed his gratitude over the love received from fans and also got candid about his friendship with Amaal Malik.

Forbidden Fruits teaser: Lili Reinhart, Lola Tung front witch-cult thriller Forbidden Fruits, directed by Meredith Alloway, introduces a star-studded cast in a horror film centred around a hidden witch cult within a mall store. It stars Lili Reinhart, Lola Tung and Victoria Pedretti.

Bollywood in a spot: Gone are the days, or can Hindi cinema bounce back? Bollywood seems to be in crisis. Mumbai Cinema is at the crossroads of big-budget flops, star power and southern challenge. What is the way for the Hindi film industry to recover?

Actor Vinayakan confirms return in Jailer 2 amid buzz over Rajinikanth's sequel Malayalam actor Vinayakan has officially confirmed his participation in director Nelson's Jailer 2, which stars Rajinikanth. The production continues to draw attention, with Rajinikanth and other notable actors involved, and the shoot is expected to conclude in December.

Nicholas Hoult, Daisy Edgar-Jones reunite in Disney+ UK comedy series Mosquito Disney+ orders six-episode UK original series Mosquito, starring Nicholas Hoult and Daisy Edgar-Jones and written by Tony McNamara, with filming set to begin in 2026.

Ranveer Singh, Deepika Padukone shine at his cousin's Goa wedding. Watch Bollywood actors Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone recently attended a family wedding in Goa, sharing moments of celebration and tradition with relatives. A video from the wedding is now going viral on social media.

Jimmy Shergill turns 55: A look at the roles that helped him survive all weathers Jimmy Shergill, who turns 55 on December 3, has built a long and steady career by choosing diverse roles and delivering honest performances. Even without constant spotlight, he continues to stay relevant through versatility and screen presence.

Raj Nidimoru's sister welcomes Samantha: We stand by them without hesitation Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru's wedding on December 1 in Coimbatore was followed by a warm family welcome, with Raj's sister sharing a heartfelt message and the first family portrait.

Rana Daggubati, Dulquer Salmaan react to Deepika Padukone's 8-hour shift stance Actor-producer Rana Daggubati and Dulquer Salmaan addressed the practicality and realities of fixed-hour workdays on film sets following renewed debate sparked by Deepika Padukone's remarks.

Stranger Things 5 breaks Netflix record, all seasons in top 10 The fifth season of Stranger Things has achieved the largest English-language series launch on Netflix, with 59.6 million views in its first five days. The release, which included only four episodes initially, has also led to all five of the show's seasons appearing on the platform's Top 10 chart.

Why Tere Ishk Mein is the most complex and provocative love story in a while Tere Ishk Mein isn't a film you simply watch, it's a film that pulls you into a psychological storm. Messy, flawed, provocative and emotionally unsettling.

Potter meets Malfoy: Daniel Radcliffe, Tom Felton reunite after 14 years for Broadway Actors Daniel Radcliffe and Tom Felton, well-known for their roles in the Harry Potter series, met in New York City at a special screening of the filmed version of Merrily We Roll Along, in which Radcliffe starred in its recent stage revival.

Miley Cyrus confirms engagement to Maxx Morando, shares what astounded her most Singer Miley Cyrus has confirmed her engagement to musician Maxx Morando after four years of dating. Cyrus opened up about the significance of their relationship, the importance of privacy, and the symbolism behind their connection in a recent interview.

Bigg Boss 19: Rajiv Adatia supports Gaurav Khanna after emotional breakdown Rajiv Adatia has voiced support for Bigg Boss 19 finalist Gaurav Khanna after a journalist's question regarding his family life prompted an emotional response at a recent press conference.

Stray Kids sweep 6 Billboard Charts; Do It lands Hot 100 debut K-pop boy band Stray Kids have set a new milestone on the Billboard charts, as their album DO IT debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 this week. The group became the first artist to have their first eight chart entries premiere at the top position.

Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar to feature 4-minute post-credit scene: Report Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh and directed by Aditya Dhar, is set for a major release on December 5, 2025. The film features a 4-minute post-credits scene and is now one of the lengthiest Indian films, surpassing Animal and Pushpa 2 in runtime.

Mammootty on his role in upcoming film Kalamkaval: You may not like my character Mammootty revealed insights into his role and the casting decisions for his upcoming film Kalamkaval, highlighting his preference for Vinayakan in the lead. The film is set to release in theatres on December 5.

Winona Ryder reveals tragic inspiration behind Little Women role Winona Ryder reflects on a tragic event from her early twenties that deeply influenced her performances in both Little Women and Stranger Things, sharing how personal loss shaped her approach to portraying grief and resilience on screen.

general news.headline: Congress posts AI video of PM selling tea at red-carpet event, triggers rowThe BJP was quick to condemn the AI-generated video, accusing the Congress of "abusing" Prime Minister Narendra Modi yet again.

Sanchar Saathi in iPhone? Govt order may start privacy tiff between India and AppleIs it mandatory or is it not? The jury is still out on Sanchar Saathi app. But it is clear that the government wants it pre-installed on phones, including iPhone. That may lead to another tiff between Apple and India. Again.

80,000 Afghans gather to watch a 13-year-old execute the killer of his familyA 13-year-old boy executed a man convicted of murdering 13 members of his family in Afghanistan's eastern province of Khost. Around 80,000 people watched the execution, which was ordered by the Afghan Supreme Court and sanctioned by the Taliban's supreme leader, Hibatullah Akhundzada. The public execution has been condemned by the UN Special Rapporteur on Afghanistan.

Nehru sought public funds to build Babri Masjid, claims Rajnath SinghThe Union Minister said Jawaharlal Nehru's plan to construct the Babri Masjid using public funds was thwarted by Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel.

Assam doctor steps in after family claims woman is 'acting' despite critical stateThrough his post on X, Dr Priyam Bordoloi attempted to explain how family dismissal and medical negligence within households can endanger lives.

Trump accuses US allies of ripping country off: Won't use names, but...Trump criticised American allies Japan and South Korea for 'ripping off' the US amid global tariff discussions, highlighting long-standing trade disputes in a candid meeting.

Can Jamaat-e-Islami spring a surprise by beating BNP in Bangladesh?The Khaleda Zia-led BNP was considered an unchallenged frontrunner in the Bangladesh general election promised in February 2026 by chief advisor Muhammad Yunus. A new poll shows the Jamaat-e-Islami breathing down the BNP's neck with a difference of just four percentage points. This is why the Jamaat gained and why India needs to be prepared for any eventuality.

Apple could soon launch another iPhone 17 model at a lower price, 3 major features leakedApple could soon launch another iPhone 17 model at a lower price as details about its possible release timeline and major features have leaked online. Here is everything you need to know.

Rejuvenated Rohit, Virat look to seal series for India in RaipurIND vs SA: India arrive in Raipur having won a tense opening fixture in Ranchi. Rejuvenated by the presence of Rohit and Kohli, the hosts will look to seal the series in the second ODI.
Watch: Trump appears to fight sleep during 3-hour-long cabinet meetingThe 79-year-old president appeared to have difficulty staying awake at several points during the three-hour cabinet meeting.

US tax rules for F-1 and J-1 visa: What Indian students must knowStudying in the US is a dream for thousands of Indian students each year, but it also comes with important tax responsibilities. Even without earning income, students on F-1 or J-1 visas may need to file specific IRS forms to stay compliant.

Ready for war with Europe: Putin's stern warning as Ukraine peace talks stallIf there were any such conflict, the Russian President warned that the defeat of the European powers would be so absolute that there would be no one left to negotiate a peace deal.

The soldier village of India: Where nearly every home has a 'jawan'Gahmar, India's largest village of soldiers, continues to inspire generations with its deep-rooted military heritage. Despite modern challenges, the community's commitment to defence service remains unwavering and a source of collective pride.

Live: Rajya Sabha may move motion against Renuka Chaudhary over 'barking' remarkParliament Winter Session Live: On Wednesday, the Rajya Sabha is likely to initiate a privilege motion against Renuka Chaudhary over her recent remarks involving "dogs and barking," which the House views as a potential breach of parliamentary dignity and security norms. The Upper House is currently examining the matter, even as political strategy intensifies ahead of the next sitting. Leaders of the INDIA bloc are scheduled to meet tomorrow at 9.45 am in Parliament to plan their coordinated strategy on the floor of the House. Meanwhile, an all-party meeting has reached a consensus to hold a full-day debate on Vande Mataram on Tuesday, followed by discussions on poll reforms on December 9.

Abandoned in cold, newborn finds unlikely company all-night long in BengalA newborn abandoned in the cold in Bengal's Nadia district was found safe after street dogs formed a protective circle around the baby through the night.

Can't roll out red carpet for intruders: Supreme Court on missing Rohingyas pleaThe Supreme Court slammed a petition seeking the tracking of five Rohingya refugees, asking, "If an intruder is caught under the law, do you want us to roll out a red carpet for them?"

Ranveer Singh, Deepika Padukone shine at his cousin's Goa wedding. WatchBollywood actors Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone recently attended a family wedding in Goa, sharing moments of celebration and tradition with relatives. A video from the wedding is now going viral on social media.

We value them: Russia approves key pact with India ahead of Putin's visitRussia's lower house of parliament approved a key military pact with India, enabling mutual logistical support for military operations, exercises, and disaster relief, ahead of President Putin's New Delhi visit.

India's next in line: Jaiswal, Ruturaj must prove they belong nowTwo young batters, two crossroads. Jaiswal battles a left-arm pace weakness, Gaikwad seeks validation in his best format. South Africa will reveal whether they're stopgaps—or pillars of India's ODI future.

National Guard shooting suspect shouted 'Allahu Akbar' while firing: ProsecutorsDuring his first appearance in court virtually from a hospital bed, Rahmanullah Lakanwal, the 29-year-old Afghan national who carried out the shooting, was charged with murder, assault with intent to kill, and possession of a firearm during a violent crime.

sports.headline: SA came to India with purpose and belief, not just to compete: Tabraiz Shamsi Tabraiz Shamsi feels South Africa's strong preparation and collective belief proved crucial in whitewashing India 2-0. He credited the team for overcoming previous challenges and scripting history.

2nd ODI Live: Can rampant Ro-Ko seal series in Raipur? India vs South Africa 2nd ODI Live Score and Updates: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will be aiming to continue their rampant form as India hope to seal the series with a win in Raipur. The Proteas will be eager to put the Ranchi disappointment behind them and welcome back Temba Bavuma into the mix and push the game into the decider.

Watch: Virat Kohli unleashes six barrage in Raipur to thrill fans ahead of 2nd ODI Virat Kohli went on a six-hitting rampage to thrill the fans in Raipur on the eve of the second ODI between India and South Africa. Kohli and the Indian team put in the final touches as they aim to seal the series with a win on Wednesday, December 3.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in World Cup 2027? Hope they don't make it, jokes Gurbaz Afghanistan wicketkeeper Rahmanullah Gurbaz said that no one can say that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli shouldn't be in the squad for the ODI World Cup 2027. Gurbaz, however, joked that he won't mind having to face the duo during the ICC event.

Serena Williams denies tennis return despite re-entering anti-doping test pool Serena Williams put to rest mounting speculation about her tennis future after confirming she has no plans to return, even as her re-entry into the International Tennis Integrity Agency anti-doping pool stoked widespread comeback rumors.

Haaland creates history as Manchester City down Fulham in goal fest Manchester City extended their winning streak over Fulham with a 5–4 victory, as Erling Haaland became the fastest player to reach 100 Premier League goals. Newcastle and Tottenham played out a 2–2 draw, with Cristian Romero scoring twice for Spurs, including a stoppage-time equaliser.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma still going as hard as 28–30-year-olds, says Madan Lal Madan Lal says Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are playing with the freshness and intensity of 28–30-year-olds, insisting the senior duo should decide their own ODI future as they continue to drive India's performances.

No pressure of paycheque but motivated to do well for UP Warriorz in WPL: DeeptiAfter being bought back by the UP Warriorz for Rs 3.2 crore ahead of the upcoming Women's Premier League, star India all-rounder Deepti Sharma said the price tag brings her no pressure and, if anything, only pushes her to perform better in the fourth edition of the tournament.

Ben Stokes plays down England's dismal Gabba record ahead of pink-ball TestEngland captain Ben Stokes said his side carries no fear of the Gabba despite the venue's daunting Ashes history. Stokes said the current England squad has the confidence and edge to challenge Australia in their own backyard.

Virat Kohli set to play Vijay Hazare Trophy after 15 yearsStar India batter Virat Kohli on Tuesday informed the Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) that he will be available for the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy, marking his first appearance in the domestic one-day competition since 2010.

In-form Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma train hard in nets ahead of Ranchi ODIVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma trained hard during an intense net session, taking on throw-down specialists in tandem ahead of Wednesday's second ODI against South Africa.

Operation Sagar Bandhu continues amid catastrophic flooding and landslides.

India to name T20I squad on Wednesday, medical update on Shubman Gill awaitedIndia vs South Africa: The selectors will announce India's T20I squad for the South Africa series on Wednesday (December 3), with the final decision hinging on an expected medical update on Shubman Gill.

Deepender Hooda Blames Haryana Govt Negligence for Death of Two Basketball PlayersIn this special report, Congress MP Deepender Hooda condemns the Haryana government for 'criminal negligence' following the tragic deaths of two young basketball players, Hardik Rathi and Aman, due to collapsing infrastructure. Hooda highlights the decay of sports facilities in the state, revealing, 'I gave 18.5 lakh rupees... for three years the government of Haryana refused to spend that money' on the Lakhan Majra stadium. The Rohtak MP demands ₹1 crore compensation and government jobs for the victims' families, asserting that the state's renowned sports culture is crumbling under the current administration.

AIFF eye flexibility in meeting with Sports Minister on ISL commercial rights tenderWith the ISL tender drawing zero bidders and structural concerns mounting, AIFF arrives for crisis talks, willing to be flexible on commercial terms—provided the government steps in to support national teams and key competitions.

Harshit Rana shrugs off outside noise, credits Kohli-Rohit for guidanceUnder scrutiny for allegedly receiving special backing from head coach Gautam Gambhir, young pacer Harshit Rana said he pays no attention to outside criticism. Rana also credited senior pros Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for playing a significant role in the good team environment.

Rohit, Kohli make team environment better, push youngsters to improve: Harshit RanaIND vs SA, 2nd ODI: Harshit Rana says the presence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli brings a positive and motivating environment to the Indian dressing room. Their guidance pushes youngsters to improve and creates a positive culture both on and off the field.

Revanth Reddy vs Lionel Messi: Telangana CM trains hard for Hyderabad face-offTelangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy hit the field at the MCHRD grounds as he continued preparations for his much-anticipated friendly football match against Argentina legend Lionel Messi on December 13.

Sorry state of Gautam Gambhir's Indian Test team reaches Supreme CourtSupreme Court judge MM Sundaresh candidly referred to India's sorry state of affairs in Test cricket. The judge said that India's focus on white-ball cricket had ruined the Test team.

After Ranchi heroics, Harshit Rana opens up on dealing with online trollingAmid accusations that head coach Gautam Gambhir favours him, Harshit Rana has often been the target of online criticism. But the young pacer says he blocks out the noise, knowing that paying attention to it would only take away the freedom he needs to bowl at his best.

Sarfaraz Khan back in IPL? Mumbai star smashes 47-ball century in SMATSyed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025: Sarfaraz Khan struck his first T20 hundred to help Mumbai thrash Assam by 98 runs on Tuesday. His performance could boost IPL auction prospects amid strong demand for middle-order batters.

Hardik Pandya clicks selfie with pitch invader during SMAT 2025 clash: WatchIndia all-rounder Hardik Pandya's return to competitive cricket for Baroda in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy has been carefully observed by selectors and team management, with his fitness under scrutiny following his recent injury and the upcoming Asia Cup final against Pakistan.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
